body_html:
I just realized that casting from/to complex numbers isn't actually supported by TensorFlow.
It will raise an error like

UnimplementedError: Cast float to complex64 is not supported

at runtime if you try to cast from/to complex numbers.
That also explains why the gradient for cast ignores complex numbers :(

@vrv: Is there interest in supporting casting complex numbers?
This would mirror what can be done in numpy, for example with

In [24]: np.cast['complex64']([1, 2, 3])
Out[24]: array([ 1.+0.j,  2.+0.j,  3.+0.j], dtype=complex64)

or

In [25]: np.array([1, 2, 3]).astype(np.complex64)
Out[25]: array([ 1.+0.j,  2.+0.j,  3.+0.j], dtype=complex64)

body:
I just realized that casting from/to complex numbers isn't actually supported by TensorFlow.
It will raise an error like

```
UnimplementedError: Cast float to complex64 is not supported
```

at runtime if you try to cast from/to complex numbers.
That also explains why the gradient for `cast` ignores complex numbers :(

@vrv: Is there interest in supporting casting complex numbers?
This would mirror what can be done in `numpy`, for example with

``` python
In [24]: np.cast['complex64']([1, 2, 3])
Out[24]: array([ 1.+0.j,  2.+0.j,  3.+0.j], dtype=complex64)
```

or

``` python
In [25]: np.array([1, 2, 3]).astype(np.complex64)
Out[25]: array([ 1.+0.j,  2.+0.j,  3.+0.j], dtype=complex64)
```
